Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2009 04:42PM Lynn0208 wrote: Good news.  Just got back from the mammogram and ultrasound.  Nothing showed up on either test, so I am thrilled.  I can't feel anything anymore either.  Thanks everyone.  :)
Posts.Title: 32 yrs old, hard lump doesn't move Lynn0208 Lynn0208

Posts.Content: Lynn0208 wrote: I am 32 years old and found a lump in my right breast on Sunday.  I called the doctor monday morning and she saw me that day.  She said that since I have no family history of breast cancer and since I'm young, she doesn't think it's cancer.  I am scheduled for a diagnostic mammogram and ultrasound next Thursday (9/3).  The thing that worries me is that I keep reading that it's a better sign if it moves and this doesn't.  It feels uncomfortable, and hurts when you press on it.  I do not have any children and have never been pregnant.  I had been taking birth control pills for 10 years, and I stopped in June.  My periods were always irregular prior to the pill and this seems to be continuing as well now.  I have also been under a ton of stress the past 3 months b/c my grandfather was very ill and actually just passed away last week.  I would appreciate any thoughts, thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 32 yrs old, hard lump doesn't move Lynn0208 Lynn0208

Posts.Content: Aug 27, 2009 11:04AM Lynn0208 wrote: Thanks again all!  I have had some changes in the last 24 hours since I posted.  The area around the lump, (which is in the 2:00 position) that had been so tender/painful to touch, thick feeling, and uncomfortable is now feeling back to normal.  However, I can still still feel the lump when sitting up.  It is much harder to locate when laying down.  I am hoping this is a good sign, but will of course still have the ultrasound and mammogram next week.
Posts.Title: 32 yrs old, hard lump doesn't move Lynn0208 Lynn0208

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2009 10:39AM Lynn0208 wrote: Don't worry about it, Mazy- it's all good.  And thanks, London- I appreciated your comments.  :) When I posted, I knew that I might hear things that would frighten me even more than I already was, but that was a risk I was willing to take to see if there was maybe someone else out there who had or has a similar situation.  Vaness, how are you doing?  The lump is now getting harder and harder to find.  I also got my period this morning!  I can not stress enough how what I was feeling earlier in the week was not the typical "I'm getting my period/ swollen, painful boobs."  This was so different.  I'm going to call my doctor on Monday and see what she has to say.
